duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage all non-choral aspects of the organization, including fundraising, administration, and logistics.
Act as Head of Finance by creating and managing an annual budget and ensuring expenses stay within budget.
Manage corporate, foundation, and individual donor relations, fundraising events, and assisting with annual fundraising appeals.
Manage all communications for the organization, both internally and externally.
Serve as the primary point of contact for the organization for various partners and vendors.
Supervise multiple direct reports and manage all administrative, development, and marketing personnel.
Oversee season production and administrative calendar, negotiate and manage all vendor contracts.
Supervise marketing efforts, create/distribute press releases, act as lead coordinator for all earned media appearances.
Manage office management and daily operations, ticketing, day-of concert volunteers, and all digital content.
Maintain and present all digital content, manage and maintain the Neon CRM database.
Co-report (with the Artistic Director) to the Board of Directors, attend monthly Board meetings.
Negotiate and manage community performance opportunities, ensure fulfillment of strategic plan goals.
Other duties as needed to support the organization's mission and operations.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s Degree required. Previous administrative and financial management experience.
Significant Management or administrative experience in a nonprofit organization is preferred.
Previous fundraising experience, including prior successful work directly participating in or managing community funding campaigns.
Strong computer skills, including Google Office Suite and web-based applications.
Driver’s license and/or reliable transportation, ability to drive rental trucks preferred.
